properties.name: Food Link
properties.description: Posted by Farmaid Founded over 29 years ago by Tom Ferraro, Foodlink has grown to serve a 10 county area in the Gene see Valley and Finger Lakes Region of Upstate New York. As a member of America’s Second Harvest, Foodlink obtains and redistributes over 7.5 million pounds of food annually to a network of over 550 programs.

properties.name: Foodlink Farmers' Market
properties.description: Posted by FarmaidThe Foodlink Farmers’ Market takes place every Wednesday June 13th through September 26th, 11am to 2pm, in Washington Square Park, along St. Mary’s Place in downtown Rochester. Come and purchase fresh, local produce and goods. WIC and EBT are accepted. For more information visit www.foodlinkny.org or call 585/328-3380 x156.

properties.name: Honest Weight Food Co-op
properties.description: Posted by Farmaid 484 Central Avenue Albany, NY 12206Honest Weight Food Co-op, founded in 1976, is open to the public seven days a week. A member-owned and -operated grocery store, Honest Weight Food Co-op is committed to providing the community with affordable, high quality natural foods and products for healthy and ecologically sustainable living. The store offers a full line of brand-name grocery products, over 500 domestic and imported cheeses from rBGH-free dairies, an extensive selection of bulk foods, and the area’s widest selection of locally produced food products.

properties.name: Just Food
properties.description: Posted by Farmaid 208 E. 51st Street, NY 10022Just Food was founded in 1995 in response to three major challenges: the loss of family farms, the rise of hunger, malnutrition, and diet-related disease, and the lack of economic opportunity in underserved neighborhoods. Because we believe a joint solution to these challenges is the best solution, our programs address all three of these issues simultaneously by building partnerships with, and providing resources and training to community groups, sustainable farmers and urban gardeners. The support we offer and the trainings we provide connect regional farmers with profitable markets and strengthen some of New York City’s most underserved neighborhoods by creating new economic opportunities, improving community health, and preserving urban green spaces. For more information please visit us at www.justfood.org

properties.name: Leda's Urban Homestead
properties.description: Posted by FarmaidPark Slope, Brooklyn, NYLeda Meredith\'s backyard vegetable and herb garden. Leda is also a CSA member, and a frequent shopper at NYC\'s farmers markets. She is supporting the local foods movement and farm aid by doing a year of eating only what grows within a 250-mile radius of Park Slope, Brooklyn. You can follow her progress with the 250 at http://ledameredith.net/wordpress.

properties.name: River Tavern Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Farmaid Chester, CTRiver Tavern restaurant is proud to be donating time to cooking delicious farm produce for Farm Aid. River Tavern is a neighborhood restaurant with a daily changing menu featuring farm fresh ingredients from local CT River Valley Farms. Owner Jonathan Rapp believes in promoting fresh and local and supporting local farms and brings this philosophy into the schools by donating his time periodically to cook healthy lunches. Plus, this summer, he partnered with Drew McLachlan of Feast Market launching Dinners at the Farm to help promote local farmers by creating mouthwatering farm fare from the back of a red, 1955 Ford, Flatbed, firetruck right on the grounds of a local farm in a festive and convivial setting. Visit www.dinnersatthefarm.com.
